scenes.title: Frankenstein's Last Words
scenes.summary: Frankenstein expresses his regrets and desires before death.
scenes.text:
not, Walton, that in the last moments of my existence I feel that burning
hatred and ardent desire of revenge I once expressed; but I feel myself
justified in desiring the death of my adversary. During these last days I
have been occupied in examining my past conduct; nor do I find it blamable.
In a fit of enthusiastic madness I created a rational creature and was
bound towards him to assure, as far as was in my power, his happiness and
well-being. This was my duty, but there was another still paramount to
that. My duties towards the beings of my own species had greater claims to
my attention because they included a greater proportion of happiness or
misery. Urged by this view, I refused, and I did right in refusing, to
create a companion for the first creature. He showed unparalleled malignity
and selfishness in evil; he destroyed my friends; he devoted to destruction
beings who possessed exquisite sensations, happiness, and wisdom; nor do I
know where this thirst for vengeance may end. Miserable himself that he may
render no other wretched, he ought to die. The task of his destruction was
mine, but I have failed. When actuated by selfish and vicious motives, I
asked you to undertake my unfinished work, and I renew this request now,
when I am only induced by reason and virtue.
"Yet I cannot ask you to renounce your country and friends to fulfil
this task; and now that you are returning to England, you will have
little chance of meeting with him. But the consideration of these
points, and the well balancing of what you may esteem your duties, I
leave to you; my judgment and ideas are already disturbed by the near
approach of death. I dare not ask you to do what I think right, for I
may still be misled by passion.
"That he should live to be an instrument of mischief disturbs me; in
other respects, this hour, when I momentarily expect my release, is the
only happy one which I have enjoyed for several years. The forms of
the beloved dead flit before me, and I hasten to their arms. Farewell,
Walton! Seek happiness in tranquillity and avoid ambition, even if it
be only the apparently innocent one of distinguishing yourself in
science and discoveries. Yet why do I say this? I have myself been
blasted in these hopes, yet another may succeed."
His voice became fainter as he spoke, and at length, exhausted by his
effort, he sank into silence. About half an hour afterwards he
attempted again to speak but was unable; he pressed my hand feebly, and
his eyes closed for ever, while the irradiation of a gentle smile passed
away from his lips.

characters.name: Justice
characters.role: Victor expresses his desire for revenge against his creature, feeling justified in wanting his death.
characters.quote: I feel myself justified in desiring the death of my adversary.

characters.name: Moral Responsibility
characters.role: Victor reflects on his duties towards his creation and humanity, weighing his responsibilities.
characters.quote: This was my duty, but there was another still paramount to that.

characters.name: Loneliness
characters.role: Victor acknowledges his loneliness and the misery caused by his actions, leading to his impending death.
characters.quote: Miserable himself that he may render no other wretched, he ought to die.

characters.name: Happiness
characters.role: Victor advises Walton to seek happiness and avoid ambition, reflecting on his own failures.
characters.quote: Seek happiness in tranquillity and avoid ambition.

scenes.title: The Monster's Grief
scenes.summary: The monster mourns Frankenstein's death and reflects on his actions.
scenes.text:
I entered the cabin where lay the remains of my ill-fated and admirable
friend. Over him hung a form which I cannot find words to
describe—gigantic in stature, yet uncouth and distorted in its
proportions. As he hung over the coffin, his face was concealed by long
locks of ragged hair; but one vast hand was extended, in colour and
apparent texture like that of a mummy. When he heard the sound of my
approach, he ceased to utter exclamations of grief and horror and sprung
towards the window. Never did I behold a vision so horrible as his face, of
such loathsome yet appalling hideousness. I shut my eyes involuntarily and
endeavoured to recollect what were my duties with regard to this destroyer.
I called on him to stay.
He paused, looking on me with wonder, and again turning towards the
lifeless form of his creator, he seemed to forget my presence, and
every feature and gesture seemed instigated by the wildest rage of some
uncontrollable passion.
"That is also my victim!" he exclaimed. "In his murder my
crimes are consummated; the miserable series of my being is wound to its
close! Oh, Frankenstein! Generous and self-devoted being! What does it
avail that I now ask thee to pardon me? I, who irretrievably destroyed thee
by destroying all thou lovedst. Alas! He is cold, he cannot answer
me."
His voice seemed suffocated, and my first impulses, which had suggested to
me the duty of obeying the dying request of my friend in destroying his
enemy, were now suspended by a mixture of curiosity and compassion. I
approached this tremendous being; I dared not again raise my eyes to his
face, there was something so scaring and unearthly in his ugliness. I
attempted to speak, but the words died away on my lips. The monster
continued to utter wild and incoherent self-reproaches. At length I
gathered resolution to address him in a pause of the tempest of his passion.
"Your repentance," I said, "is now superfluous. If you
had listened to the voice of conscience and heeded the stings of remorse
before you had urged your diabolical vengeance to this extremity,
Frankenstein would yet have lived."
"And do you dream?" said the dæmon. "Do you think that I was then
dead to agony and remorse? He," he continued, pointing to the corpse,
"he suffered not in the consummation of the deed. Oh! Not the
ten-thousandth portion of the anguish that was mine during the
lingering detail of its execution. A frightful selfishness hurried me
on, while my heart was poisoned with remorse. Think you that the
groans of Clerval were music to my ears? My heart was fashioned to be
susceptible of love and sympathy, and when wrenched by misery to vice
and hatred, it did not endure the violence of the change without
torture such as you cannot even imagine.
"After the murder of Clerval I returned to Switzerland, heart-broken
and overcome. I pitied Frankenstein; my pity amounted to horror; I
abhorred myself. But when I discovered that he, the author at once of
my existence and of its unspeakable torments, dared to hope for
happiness, that while he accumulated wretchedness and despair upon me
he sought his own enjoyment in feelings and passions from the
indulgence of which I was for ever barred, then impotent envy and bitter
indignation filled me with an insatiable thirst for vengeance. I
recollected my threat and resolved that it should be accomplished. I
knew that I was preparing for myself a deadly torture, but I was the
slave, not the master, of an impulse which I detested yet could not
disobey. Yet when she died! Nay, then I was not miserable. I had
cast off all feeling, subdued all anguish, to riot in the excess of my
despair. Evil thenceforth became my good. Urged thus far, I had no
choice but to adapt my nature to an element which I had willingly
chosen. The completion of my demoniacal design became an insatiable
passion. And now it is ended; there is my last victim!"
I was at first touched by the expressions of his misery; yet, when I called
to mind what Frankenstein had said of his powers of eloquence and
persuasion, and when I again cast my eyes on the lifeless form of my
friend, indignation was rekindled within me. "Wretch!" I said.
"It is well that you come here to whine over the desolation that you
have made. You throw a torch into a pile of buildings, and when they are
consumed, you sit among the ruins and lament the fall. Hypocritical fiend!
If he whom you mourn still lived, still would he be the object, again would
he become the prey, of your accursed vengeance. It is not pity that you
feel; you lament only because the victim of your malignity is withdrawn
from your power."
"Oh, it is not thus—not thus," interrupted the being.
"Yet such must be the impression conveyed to you by what appears to
be the purport of my actions. Yet I seek not a fellow feeling in my misery.
No sympathy may I ever find. When I first sought it, it was the love of
virtue, the feelings of happiness and affection with which my whole being
overflowed, that I wished to be participated. But now that virtue has
become to me a shadow, and that happiness and affection are turned into
bitter and loathing despair, in what should I seek for sympathy? I am
content to suffer alone while my sufferings shall endure; when I die, I am
well satisfied that abhorrence and opprobrium should load my memory. Once
my fancy was soothed with dreams of virtue, of fame, and of enjoyment. Once
I falsely hoped to meet with beings who, pardoning my outward form, would
love me for the excellent qualities which I was capable of unfolding. I was
nourished with high thoughts of honour and devotion. But now crime has
degraded me beneath the meanest animal. No guilt, no mischief, no
malignity, no misery, can be found comparable to mine. When I run over the
frightful catalogue of my sins, I cannot believe that I am the same
creature whose thoughts were once filled with sublime and transcendent
visions of the beauty and the majesty of goodness. But it is even so; the
fallen angel becomes a malignant devil. Yet even that enemy of God and man
had friends and associates in his desolation; I am alone.
"You, who call Frankenstein your friend, seem to have a knowledge of my
crimes and his misfortunes. But in the detail which he gave you of them
he could not sum up the hours and months of misery which I endured
wasting in impotent passions. For while I destroyed his hopes, I did
not satisfy my own desires. They were for ever ardent and craving; still
I desired love and fellowship, and I was still spurned. Was there no
injustice in this? Am I to be thought the only criminal, when all
humankind sinned against me? Why do you not hate Felix, who drove his
friend from his door with contumely? Why do you not execrate the rustic
who sought to destroy the saviour of his child? Nay, these are virtuous
and immaculate beings! I, the miserable and the abandoned, am an
abortion, to be spurned at, and kicked, and trampled on. Even now my
blood boils at the recollection of this injustice.
"But it is true that I am a wretch. I have murdered the lovely and
the helpless; I have strangled the innocent as they slept and grasped to
death his throat who never injured me or any other living thing. I have
devoted my creator, the select specimen of all that is worthy of love and
admiration among men, to misery; I have pursued him even to that
irremediable ruin. There he lies, white and cold in death. You hate me, but
your abhorrence cannot equal that with which I regard myself. I look on the
hands which executed the deed; I think on the heart in which the
imagination of it was conceived and long for the moment when these hands
will meet my eyes, when that imagination will haunt my thoughts no more.
"Fear not that I shall be the instrument of future mischief. My work
is nearly complete. Neither yours nor any man's death is needed to
consummate the series of my being and accomplish that which must be done,
but it requires my own. Do not think that I shall be slow to perform this
sacrifice. I shall quit your vessel on the ice raft which brought me
thither and shall seek the most northern extremity of the globe; I shall
collect my funeral pile and consume to ashes this miserable frame, that its
remains may afford no light to any curious and unhallowed wretch who would
create such another as I have been. I shall die. I shall no longer feel the
agonies which now consume me or be the prey of feelings unsatisfied, yet
unquenched. He is dead who called me into being; and when I shall be no
more, the very remembrance of us both will speedily vanish. I shall no
longer see the sun or stars or feel the winds play on my cheeks. Light,
feeling, and sense will pass away; and in this condition must I find my
happiness. Some years ago, when the images which this world affords first
opened upon me, when I felt the cheering warmth of summer and heard the
rustling of the leaves and the warbling of the birds, and these were all to
me, I should have wept to die; now it is my only consolation. Polluted by
crimes and torn by the bitterest remorse, where can I find rest but in
death?
"Farewell! I leave you, and in you the last of humankind whom these
eyes will ever behold. Farewell, Frankenstein! If thou wert yet alive
and yet cherished a desire of revenge against me, it would be better
satiated in my life than in my destruction. But it was not so; thou
didst seek my extinction, that I might not cause greater wretchedness;
and if yet, in some mode unknown to me, thou hadst not ceased to think
and feel, thou wouldst not desire against me a vengeance greater than
that which I feel. Blasted as thou wert, my agony was still superior to
thine, for the bitter sting of remorse will not cease to rankle in my
wounds until death shall close them for ever.
"But soon," he cried with sad and solemn enthusiasm, "I
shall die, and what I now feel be no longer felt. Soon these burning
miseries will be extinct. I shall ascend my funeral pile triumphantly and
exult in the agony of the torturing flames. The light of that conflagration
will fade away; my ashes will be swept into the sea by the winds. My spirit
will sleep in peace, or if it thinks, it will not surely think thus.
Farewell."
He sprang from the cabin-window as he said this, upon the ice raft
which lay close to the vessel. He was soon borne away by the waves and
lost in darkness and distance.

characters.name: Guilt
characters.role: The creature expresses deep regret for his actions and the pain he has caused.
characters.quote: Oh, Frankenstein! Generous and self-devoted being! What does it avail that I now ask thee to pardon me? I, who irretrievably destroyed thee by destroying all thou lovedst.

characters.name: Loneliness
characters.role: The creature laments his loneliness and lack of companionship.
characters.quote: I am alone.

characters.name: Destruction And Loss
characters.role: The creature reflects on his actions driven by a desire for revenge.
characters.quote: Yet when she died! Nay, then I was not miserable. I had cast off all feeling, subdued all anguish, to riot in the excess of my despair.

characters.name: Selflessness And Sacrifice
characters.role: The creature contemplates his own death as a release from suffering.
characters.quote: I shall die. I shall no longer feel the agonies which now consume me or be the prey of feelings unsatisfied, yet unquenched.

characters.name: Humanity And Sympathy
characters.role: The creature seeks understanding and sympathy but feels rejected by humanity.
characters.quote: But now crime has degraded me beneath the meanest animal.

characters.name: Adventure And Discovery
characters.quote: I feel a cold northern breeze play upon my cheeks, which braces my nerves and fills me with delight.

characters.name: Ambition And Glory
characters.quote: My life might have been passed in ease and luxury, but I preferred glory to every enticement that wealth placed in my path.
characters.explanation: The gold color symbolizes the pursuit of ambition and the glory that comes with achievement.

characters.name: Fear And Courage
characters.quote: My courage and my resolution is firm; but my hopes fluctuate, and my spirits are often depressed.

characters.name: Nature's Beauty
characters.quote: There, snow and frost are banished; and, sailing over a calm sea, we may be wafted to a land surpassing in wonders and in beauty every region hitherto discovered.
characters.explanation: The vibrant green represents the beauty and life found in nature.

characters.name: Loneliness
characters.quote: I have no friend, Margaret: when I am glowing with the enthusiasm of success, there will be none to participate my joy; if I am assailed by disappointment, no one will endeavour to sustain me in dejection.
characters.explanation: This calming blue represents the deep emotional state of loneliness, evoking feelings of sadness and isolation.

characters.name: Desire For Connection
characters.quote: I desire the company of a man who could sympathise with me, whose eyes would reply to mine.
characters.explanation: This warm orange reflects the yearning for connection and the warmth of relationships.

characters.name: Self-reflection
characters.quote: I am too ardent in execution and too impatient of difficulties.
characters.explanation: The deep indigo represents introspection and the journey of self-discovery.

characters.name: Intellectual Growth
characters.quote: I greatly need a friend who would have sense enough not to despise me as romantic, and affection enough for me to endeavour to regulate my mind.
characters.explanation: This vibrant greenish color symbolizes the flourishing of knowledge and intellectual development.

characters.name: Nobility Of Character
characters.quote: What a noble fellow! you will exclaim.

characters.name: Selflessness And Sacrifice
characters.quote: He bestowed the whole on his rival, together with the remains of his prize-money to purchase stock.
characters.explanation: The bright yellow symbolizes the light of selflessness and the warmth of sacrifice.

characters.name: Brutality Vs. Kindness
characters.quote: I cannot overcome an intense distaste to the usual brutality exercised on board ship.

characters.name: Determination
characters.quote: my resolutions. Those are as fixed as fate

characters.name: Patience
characters.quote: my voyage is only now delayed until the weather shall permit my embarkation

characters.name: Resilience
characters.quote: the winter has been dreadfully severe, but the spring promises well

characters.name: Hope And Perseverance
characters.quote: But success _shall_ crown my endeavours. Wherefore not?

characters.name: Despair And Suffering
characters.quote: I never saw a man in so wretched a condition.
characters.explanation: The intense red symbolizes the pain and anguish associated with despair and suffering.

characters.name: Admiration And Pity
characters.quote: How can I see so noble a creature destroyed by misery without feeling the most poignant grief?

characters.name: Recovery And Hope
characters.quote: He is now much recovered from his illness and is continually on the deck.

characters.name: Knowledge And Wisdom
characters.quote: I ardently hope that the gratification of your wishes may not be a serpent to sting you, as mine has been.
characters.explanation: This deep blue represents the depth and clarity of knowledge and wisdom.

characters.name: Curiosity
characters.quote: The world was to me a secret which I desired to divine.

characters.name: Contrast In Personalities
characters.quote: the diversity and contrast that subsisted in our characters drew us nearer together.

characters.name: Childhood Happiness
characters.quote: No human being could have passed a happier childhood than myself.

characters.name: Parental Influence
characters.quote: My parents were possessed by the very spirit of kindness and indulgence.

characters.name: Seclusion And Solitude
characters.quote: They gave up entirely their wandering life and fixed themselves in their native country.

characters.name: Influence Of Love
characters.quote: The saintly soul of Elizabeth shone like a shrine-dedicated lamp in our peaceful home.
characters.explanation: This bright magenta represents the powerful and uplifting influence of love.

characters.name: Gentleness Vs. Passion
characters.quote: I might have become sullen in my study, rough through the ardour of my nature, but that she was there to subdue me to a semblance of her own gentleness.

characters.name: Nostalgia
characters.quote: I feel exquisite pleasure in dwelling on the recollections of childhood.

characters.name: Misfortune
characters.quote: before misfortune had tainted my mind

characters.name: Transformation
characters.quote: it became the torrent which, in its course, has swept away all my hopes and joys.

characters.name: Regret And Consequence
characters.quote: It is even possible that the train of my ideas would never have received the fatal impulse that led to my ruin.

characters.name: Thirst For Knowledge
characters.quote: I have described myself as always having been imbued with a fervent longing to penetrate the secrets of nature.

characters.name: Discontent With Knowledge
characters.quote: I always came from my studies discontented and unsatisfied.

characters.name: Self-education
characters.quote: I was, to a great degree, self-taught with regard to my favourite studies.

characters.name: Mystery Of Nature
characters.quote: her immortal lineaments were still a wonder and a mystery.

characters.name: Nature's Power
characters.quote: I remained, while the storm lasted, watching its progress with curiosity and delight.
characters.explanation: This strong blue symbolizes the awe and majesty of nature's forces.

characters.name: Destruction And Loss
characters.quote: I never beheld anything so utterly destroyed.
characters.explanation: The brown color represents the earthiness of destruction and the weight of loss.

characters.name: Knowledge And Ignorance
characters.quote: It seemed to me as if nothing would or could ever be known.

characters.name: Despair And Ruin
characters.quote: Destiny was too potent, and her immutable laws had decreed my utter and terrible destruction.

characters.name: Search For Knowledge
characters.quote: I betook myself to the mathematics and the branches of study appertaining to that science as being built upon secure foundations.

characters.name: Conflict Of Good And Evil
characters.quote: It was a strong effort of the spirit of good, but it was ineffectual.

characters.name: Loss And Grief
characters.quote: I need not describe the feelings of those whose dearest ties are rent by that most irreparable evil, the void that presents itself to the soul, and the despair that is exhibited on the countenance.
characters.explanation: The deep purple signifies the profound sorrow and mourning associated with loss.

characters.name: Family Bonds
characters.quote: My firmest hopes of future happiness were placed on the prospect of your union.
characters.explanation: This bright cyan represents the strength and support found in family relationships.

characters.name: Ambition And Education
characters.quote: He deeply felt the misfortune of being debarred from a liberal education.

characters.name: Friendship And Farewell
characters.quote: We could not tear ourselves away from each other nor persuade ourselves to say the word 'Farewell!'.

characters.name: Change And Growth
characters.quote: I had longed to enter the world and take my station among other human beings.

characters.name: Authority And Rejection
characters.quote: You must begin your studies entirely anew.

characters.name: Mentorship
characters.quote: I am happy to have gained a disciple; and if your application equals your ability, I have no doubt of your success.

characters.name: Respect For Science
characters.quote: These were men to whose indefatigable zeal modern philosophers were indebted for most of the foundations of their knowledge.

characters.name: Scientific Discovery
characters.quote: None but those who have experienced them can conceive of the enticements of science.

characters.name: Life And Death
characters.quote: To examine the causes of life, we must first have recourse to death.

characters.name: Human Anatomy
characters.quote: I saw how the fine form of man was degraded and wasted; I beheld the corruption of death succeed to the blooming cheek of life.

characters.name: Supernatural Vs. Natural
characters.quote: I do not ever remember to have trembled at a tale of superstition or to have feared the apparition of a spirit.

characters.name: Creation And Responsibility
characters.quote: Learn from me, if not by my precepts, at least by my example, how dangerous is the acquirement of knowledge.
characters.explanation: The orange hue reflects the energy and responsibility that comes with creation.

characters.name: Ambition And Hubris
characters.quote: I was too much exalted by my first success to permit me to doubt of my ability to give life to an animal as complex and wonderful as man.

characters.name: Creation And Destruction
characters.quote: Who shall conceive the horrors of my secret toil as I dabbled among the unhallowed damps of the grave or tortured the living animal to animate the lifeless clay?

characters.name: Isolation And Madness
characters.quote: My limbs now tremble, and my eyes swim with the remembrance; but then a resistless and almost frantic impulse urged me forward;

characters.name: Obsession
characters.quote: I could not tear my thoughts from my employment, loathsome in itself, but which had taken an irresistible hold of my imagination.

characters.name: Creation And Horror
characters.quote: I had desired it with an ardour that far exceeded moderation; but now that I had finished, the beauty of the dream vanished, and breathless horror and disgust filled my heart.

characters.name: Nightmares And Guilt
characters.quote: I started from my sleep with horror; a cold dew covered my forehead, my teeth chattered, and every limb became convulsed.

characters.name: Horror
characters.quote: Oh! No mortal could support the horror of that countenance.

characters.name: Fear
characters.quote: Oh! No mortal could support the horror of that countenance.
characters.explanation: The dark red symbolizes the intense emotions and anxiety associated with fear.

characters.name: Disappointment
characters.quote: mingled with this horror, I felt the bitterness of disappointment; dreams that had been my food and pleasant rest for so long a space were now become a hell to me;

characters.name: Joy
characters.quote: Nothing could equal my delight on seeing Clerval; his presence brought back to my thoughts my father, Elizabeth, and all those scenes of home so dear to my recollection.

characters.name: Guilt
characters.quote: I feel the greatest remorse for the disappointment of which I have been the occasion, but you will forgive me.
characters.explanation: The soft pink reflects the emotional weight and remorse associated with guilt.

characters.name: Concern For Others
characters.quote: I will write instantly and relieve them from the anxiety they must feel.

characters.name: Fatigue From Effort
characters.quote: this exertion greatly fatigued me;

characters.name: Mental Struggle
characters.quote: I had conceived a violent antipathy even to the name of natural philosophy.

characters.name: Friendship Support
characters.quote: Excellent friend! how sincerely you did love me, and endeavour to elevate my mind until it was on a level with your own.

characters.name: Longing For Home
characters.quote: I longed to see my native town and my beloved friends.

characters.name: Seasonal Change
characters.quote: the spring was uncommonly late, when it came its beauty compensated for its dilatoriness.

characters.name: Farewell Journey
characters.quote: I might bid a personal farewell to the country I had so long inhabited.

characters.name: Exercise And Nature
characters.quote: I was fond of exercise.

characters.name: Restoration
characters.quote: my health and spirits had long been restored, and they gained additional strength from the salubrious air I breathed

characters.name: Joy In Nature
characters.quote: A serene sky and verdant fields filled me with ecstasy.

characters.name: Creativity And Imagination
characters.quote: his conversation was full of imagination; and very often, in imitation of the Persian and Arabic writers, he invented tales of wonderful fancy and passion.

characters.name: Innocence And Violence
characters.quote: the print of the murder's finger was on his neck.

characters.name: Hope And Healing
characters.quote: Come, Victor; not brooding thoughts of vengeance against the assassin, but with feelings of peace and gentleness, that will heal, instead of festering, the wounds of our minds.

characters.name: Despair And Agitation
characters.quote: I threw the letter on the table, and covered my face with my hands.

characters.name: Melancholy Journey
characters.quote: My journey was very melancholy.

characters.name: Fear Of Change
characters.quote: I dared no advance, dreading a thousand nameless evils that made me tremble.

characters.name: Restoration Through Nature
characters.quote: By degrees the calm and heavenly scene restored me.

characters.name: Foreboding
characters.quote: I foresaw obscurely that I was destined to become the most wretched of human beings.

characters.name: Guilt And Responsibility
characters.quote: I had turned loose into the world a depraved wretch, whose delight was in carnage and misery; had he not murdered my brother?
characters.explanation: The light pink reflects the emotional complexity of guilt intertwined with responsibility.

characters.name: Loss And Mourning
characters.quote: Tears, unrestrained, fell from my brother's eyes; a sense of mortal agony crept over my frame.

characters.name: Innocence
characters.quote: Justine, poor, good Justine, is innocent.

characters.name: Justice
characters.quote: If she is, as you believe, innocent, rely on the justice of our laws.

characters.name: Family Loyalty
characters.quote: I rely on her innocence as certainly as I do upon my own.

characters.name: Innocence And Tragedy
characters.quote: one a smiling babe full of innocence and joy, the other far more dreadfully murdered, with every aggravation of infamy that could make the murder memorable in horror.

characters.name: Mockery Of Justice
characters.quote: this wretched mockery of justice

characters.name: Sacrifice And Suffering
characters.quote: A thousand times rather would I have confessed myself guilty of the crime ascribed to Justine.

characters.name: Innocence And Guilt
characters.quote: Yet she appeared confident in innocence and did not tremble, although gazed on and execrated by thousands.

characters.name: Beauty In Sorrow
characters.quote: her countenance, always engaging, was rendered, by the solemnity of her feelings, exquisitely beautiful.

characters.name: Public Judgment
characters.quote: obliterated in the minds of the spectators by the imagination of the enormity she was supposed to have committed.

characters.name: Tranquility Under Pressure
characters.quote: she was tranquil, yet her tranquillity was evidently constrained;

characters.name: Sorrowful Affection
characters.quote: a look of sorrowful affection seemed to attest her utter guiltlessness.

characters.name: Hysteria
characters.quote: she fell into violent hysterics and kept her bed for several days.

characters.name: Fear And Cowardice
characters.quote: fear and hatred of the crime of which they supposed her guilty rendered them timorous and unwilling to come forward.

characters.name: Compassion And Loyalty
characters.quote: she appeared to me the most amiable and benevolent of human creatures.

characters.name: Public Indignation
characters.quote: the public indignation was turned with renewed violence, charging her with the blackest ingratitude.

characters.name: Innocence Vs Guilt
characters.quote: I believe and rely on her perfect innocence.

characters.name: Remorse And Agony
characters.quote: the fangs of remorse tore my bosom and would not forgo their hold.
